noun.description: Stress applied to an object during manufacture or prior to some other treatment, usually in order to counteract applied loads.

adjective.description: Linguistics. Occurring before a stressed syllable.

verb.description: To apply stress to (an object or material) during manufacture or prior to some other treatment, especially so as to counteract applied loads; specifically to reinforce concrete with steel rods or wires which have been tensioned while the concrete is setting.

origin: 1930s. From pre- + stress. With the noun compare prestress<br>1930s. From pre- + stress. Compare prestress.
